result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew M Mauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Design.Drugs(>50g), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(hm)4.
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant to serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive for failure to pay. Pay all supervision fees.
Concurrent with: to Count 2, and consecutive with any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon that he may never possess a firearm.
No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Complete a mental health evaluation and must comply with any recommended treatment. Defendant to take all prescribed medication.
Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests.
Cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
AODA assessment and must satisfactorily complete any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt: Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. jbs
Received and filed:  Original Transcript of SENTENCING HEARING Proceedings commencing AUGUST 15, 2014  (61 pages) and Certification of Filing Transcript.

Defendant Matthew M Mauer in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2, and CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  2 YEARS, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1, and CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  The defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 

The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision on counts 1 and 2:  

- Complete a mental health evaluation and must comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to take all prescribed medication.
- AODA assessment and must satisfactorily complete any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests.
- Seek and maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Defendant to serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive for failure to pay.
- Pay all supervision fees.  

Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon that he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  aw
Letters for sentencing, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Matthew M Mauer in court with attorney Amber K Rumpf.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 8/25/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   aw
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Matthew M Mauer in court with attorney Amber K Rumpf.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing in Branch 3. Court ordered Defendant not to be in possession of any illegal drugs without a valid prescription, and no possession of any firearms. Court ordered Defendant to follow all conditions of bail.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew M Mauer in court with attorney Amber Kay Rumpf.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel needs time to review discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/21/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew M Mauer in court with attorney Amber Kay Rumpf.  Nathaniel Adamson for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances (illegal drugs) without a valid prescription.

Defendant Matthew M Mauer in court with attorney Amber Kay Rumpf.  Zach Whittow under the student practice rule supervised by Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
